Fields.DialogueText: Chiyoda! It's good to see you again!
And you, Kanchou! How was shore leave?
It was fine. All-in-all, though, I’m glad to be back aboard our humble seaplane tender.
Humble, you say?
Exceedingly humble, actually. More humble than any ship I've ever seen sail the sea.
The most humble in the world then?
By far.
It's good to have you back, Kanchou.
It'll be good to get back into the swing of things.
The Morganas gave my daily life structure and a routine, and I'm looking forward to resuming both.
The next fleet's due any second now.
How grand. It will be like seeing an old friend again.
I don't often make friends with those who aspire to kill me, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Good. That should serve you well in life.
I thought you had bonded so closely with Delusion, though!
It would appear you're in the wrong business, then.

Fields.DialogueText: But is that not exactly what you are doing, Kanchou?
Oh no, Delusion and I never got along very well. Why, were you showing hospitality to our greatest threats so far?
Just because I mean to sink our enemies, rather than invite them over for tea? I hope tea is not what you're planning, Kanchou...
You've got me figured out, clearly.
Say. Isn't that our old friend in the distance right now?
You mean your old friend.
Yes, our old friend. That's them now.
I say we show them a good time, then.
Agreed.
@BATTLE
Chiyoda? We should be on course to intercept a Morgana group. I hope this isn't a bad time for a fight...
Oh, not at all, Kanchou! I just wanted to show you something!
This isn't...
It is.
A bound copy of Chiyoda's Crew?
It's a prototype copy, so it's not ready for publication yet, but yes! I've secured a publisher!
Chiyoda, that's incredible! And here we were hoping the individual paintings would survive by themselves...
But instead, there's going to be a copy of Chiyoda's Crew in every household in Japan!
Kanchou! I wouldn't say that! But perhaps a few people might be interested...
That's your reflexive humility talking. This book will be found in every household in the entire world, without question!
Kanchou, no!
Oh, yes. I'm convinced.
During the attack by Delusion? I spoke of our time together in the foreword.
... So you did. Discreetly, I presume.
Of course, mentioning nothing of names or dates or any such sensitive information. It was such an important time in my life, though...
I couldn't leave it unmentioned.

Fields.MenuText: Nor would I expect you to.
Sensitive information aside, of course.
I wouldn't have, either.

Fields.DialogueText: That's kind of you to say.
Hai. Of course.
I'm very glad to hear that, Kanchou.
Are you ready? I believe our friends are knocking.
Hai!
@BATTLE
... That sure was a crazy time, wasn't it?
I can't begin to tell you what a joy it is to see you painting again, Chiyoda.
That's strange. It's not felt like any time has passed.
Between?
Oh, well - between any two paintings.
I see. What are you painting now?
A flock of seagulls scattering. It's extremely difficult to capture an image of their doing so, so I'm trying my hardest to create a convincing impression.
I wish that you had more to paint other than the same birds every day.
Oh, it's quite all right, Kanchou. Every painting is still a challenge and a joy, even if there are superficial similarities.
I don't particularly need new subjects. At least, not yet.
The repetition doesn't dull the appeal?
Honestly, I'm just enjoying the calm before what will inevitably be our next conflict.
I believe it's on its way. The crew's already on alert.
No. I mean our next challenge...  something bigger than just another fight.

Fields.MenuText: Are you worried that Delusion will return?
An ambush? New mission?
I'm not sure I get what you're talking about.

Fields.DialogueText: No. It's not that at all.
Chigau. I'm not making myself clear, I know.
Well, let me try to explain.
Things have been working very smoothly around here ever since the attack by Delusion.
It can't last.
There's that fatalism again, Chiyoda. We'll be fine.
You misunderstand me. I have the utmost confidence that we'll survive whatever is coming to us. But it's coming. These are times of war.
I'm not mistaking them for times of peace.
Heavy words, Chiyoda.
And just in time for the daily grind. Ready?
Let me just put my paintbrush down first.
@BATTLE
I missed this.
Missed this?
Moments like this. Quiet and contemplative, yet conversational.
It was always calming right before an attack, I agree.
Yes.
You've not told me about your shore leave yet.
Well, some of it ended up getting classified. I... uh... turn out not to be very good at just relaxing and not getting shot at. I'm glad to be back.
Anything you'd be in a hurry to go back to?
Nothing particularly special, I promise you.
Well, Kanchou, any new dining experience would be special to me. You understand.
Right. Funny, I still often forget that you're a Belle, even though we spend so much time together.
It's...
Certainly useful for combat.

Fields.MenuText: I couldn't agree more.
Certainly there are other advantages to being a Belle?
Ouch. It's that frustrating?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you think so, Kanchou. Just occasionally I grow tired of my limitations, however.
The ability to scout enemy ships and occasionally the sky is both helpful and kind of fun. I grow weary of my limitations, though.
Well, it's certainly not unendurable. But there are limitations to my existence that are... maybe "frustrating" *is* the word.
Would you take a break from the nautical life if you could? I mean, a real one - leave your ship form behind and spend months in the mountains, or...?
No, far from it. This ship is my body, and I get to explore so much by sailing the seas.
But it would be nice to be able to look forward to a day when I could join you in a restaurant... I don't know. Small things like that.
I understand. And, for what it's worth, I think it could happen. Your abilities - if that's the word - are obviously still maturing. I suspect your limits will be very different in a year or two.
It's kind of you to say so.
It would appear to be. Battle stations, Chiyoda!
Hai!
@BATTLE
Kanchou...
Don't look so alarmed. I'm fine.
Oh, and I got to try a few new restaurants, so that was a success.
... Well, Kanchou, I believe it's just about that time?
Kanchou! You've got to come quickly!
Is it about the Second Fleet? Have they engaged the enemy?
No, it's not that! There's been a plane crash en route to the fleet - it appears that we can still save the pilot!
Good. Pour on the speed.
Nothing pleasant. As it stands, I think we're going to be intercepted by Funayūrei before we reach the Second Fleet. I can't be sure, but I think I feel them coming.
Right. Any chance of reinforcements from Tokyo?
For the Second Fleet, yes. If the Morganas are moving as fast as I think they are, we're going to be on our own.
I can live with that. Battle stations, Chiyoda!
Hai! But what of this pilot?
What about him?
What level of priority should we place his rescue above our other duties?

Fields.MenuText: We don't leave a man behind if we can help it. Save him at all costs!
We don't know what kind of sensitive information he's privy to. Keep him away from the Morganas!
We do the best job we can of saving him while repulsing the enemy. Don't neglect defense.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai!
Hai!
Hai!
To arms!
@BATTLE
Any other word?
How's he looking, Chiyoda?
He's just woken up, Kanchou. He seems to be delirious, though - take care what you say to him.
Right.
Pilot? Pilot, can you hear me?
It’s the Captain, along with our ship's Kami, Chiyoda.
... Captain?
Take it easy. Don't speak if you don't need to.
... Is that Chiyoda-sama?
Stay calm. You're safe now.
How are you feeling?
I saw them, the, uhh... the Funayūrei ... very close by. Too close.
They're gone, pilot. You're safe.
On my plane, it appeared... in my plane.
A Morgana?
Are we safe? Are they gone, did we win?
We're safe. Just take it easy - you had a rough landing.
What did you see exactly, pilot?
Chiyoda, let him rest.
Hai.
This is very strange, seeing a plane crash so far away from the fleet. I suppose he could be a scout that got lost, but...
But the pilot is seeing Funayūrei in his plane.
What do you make of this, Chiyoda?

Fields.MenuText: Could a Morgana actually project herself into one of our aircraft? Like how a Belle can manifest on a dock?
What is your personal opinion of this? What do you think is going on here?
Considering the parallels between your existence and theirs, do you think it's possible for them to cause a pilot to hallucinate?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know, Kanchou. On a moving target, at long distance? And when the plane isn't her own? I've never heard of a ship's kami doing anything like it.
I couldn't tell you, Kanchou. This is an extremely strange set of circumstances. I'm just glad the pilot's okay.
I... I... I don't know. I've never attempted to cause hallucinations before! I wouldn't know anything about it.
Hmn.
Kanchou! More Funayūrei are approaching!
Lieutenant! Chiyoda! Battle stations!
Hai!
@BATTLE
Well, now - this is new, Chiyoda. What have you got here?
I've decided to paint a landscape. It's much more difficult than I imagined. I'd never attempted to paint islands or the ocean in great detail before.
Giving them justice, visually, has proven to be a difficult task.
Good for you for trying something new.
Well, I have to.
You have to?
Hai. I can't be painting birds and sailors forever.
Huh. I guess I misunderstood you a few days ago.
Not at all! I just thought about it afterward and changed my mind. Seagulls are lovely, but a change in subject might shock me out of certain habits.
Are you enjoying the change?
I'm not sure that's the point.

Fields.MenuText: It would be a little bit strange to have a hobby you didn't enjoy.
You really expect to learn from it, then?
I'd much rather if you were to paint exactly what you wanted to paint.

Fields.DialogueText: No stranger than the events that have occurred recently, right Kanchou?
I must. I'm readying myself for any kind of change, seeing as we're dealing with entirely new circumstances...
Who could know what will comprise most of my time, soon? We've got something entirely new on our hands.
... I feel like somehow the subject just changed to the pilot that we rescued.
Hai.
I hope that hasn't spooked you too much, Chiyoda.
Sorry, Kanchou! Funayūrei are approaching from 11 o'clock.
Great.
To arms, Chiyoda!
Hai!
@BATTLE
Chiyoda?
Chiyoda! Hello!
Oh! Kanchou! Mata oai dekite ureshii desu.
It's good to see you, too. It appears our daily grind is late today.
You don't seem upset by the notion.
It's peaceful right now - I appreciate the silence.
I suppose I am, too.
Are you available for a round of golf?
Are you sure we should be so quick to spend that kind of time when a Funayūrei is so overdue to show up?

Fields.MenuText: I think we owe it to ourselves to try once in a while.
I suppose not. Duty calls and all that.
Chiyoda, are you all right? You don't seem yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose you're right - I'm just on edge. Which I know is silly.
I don't mean to ruin your moment! I just don't want to be caught off-guard. Though we have been before and all was fine. I don't know...
I'm fine! I'm just worried that we'll be taken by surprise! Even though we're expecting it. I'm not sure.
I know. I'm acting so strangely. I'll work on correcting that.
You don't need to work on anything, just-
Uh oh.
Morganas at 1 o'clock.
Battle stations, then?
Battle stations, Chiyoda.
@BATTLE
I'm sure that the Morganas will arrive eventually, but I'm really enjoying the break.
Not about the Funayūrei on their way - we've dealt with them before. Just in general, I guess.
You can stay longer if you need, of course.
Oh, no. I'm really grateful, Captain, but I have to get back to my ship.
Well, unless you can swim really quickly, that's probably not going to be until morning.
That would probably be a good idea. Thank you, Captain.
Kanchou?
Come in, Chiyoda, I'm just speaking to our stow-away.
Joke all you like - that's actually a little how I feel, here.
Is this the beautiful Chiyoda-sama?
Oh, uhm, hello.
I'm sorry to stare. You're...
Glorious.
Kanchou, you... please don't make me blush!
I'm sorry if I made you uncomfortable.
But I wasn't wrong.
Well, I'm going to the mess hall. Thanks again, Kanchou. It was a pleasure meeting you, too, Chiyoda. You're truly a sight for sore eyes.
Arigatō. You're very kind.
And don't worry. The food won't bite back.
What do you think of him, Chiyoda?
I'm not sure. The whole situation has left me feeling uncomfortable.

Fields.MenuText: Was it because of the way we commented about your appearance? If it made you uncomfortable, I'll see to it that it does not happen again.
Is it the mysterious circumstances in which he appeared? There's very little I can do about that.
Is it regarding the Morgana that supposedly had haunted him? I hope that hasn't disturbed you too deeply.

Fields.DialogueText: I won't push it, then.
By the way, I believe it's just about that time.
Hai!
To arms, Chiyoda!
@BATTLE
If they're ready to kick you out of sick bay, I bet we can scare you up a bunk.
Exactly.
Well, that was delicious. I believe more so than usual. What would you say, Chiyoda?
You seem to be in very high spirits, Kanchou.
Should I not be?
Chigau! Just observing is all. It was as good as it's ever been. I have little to compare the meal to, however.
Next time I get some shore leave, I'll bring you something back.
That would be very kind of you, Kanchou.
For what it's worth, I like that pilot. He's got character.
If I'm being honest, Kanchou, I'm slightly relieved he's leaving.
You didn't like him?
I liked him just fine - he was very pleasant. I'd like very much to put this incident involving the Funayūrei behind us.
That happened some time ago, Chiyoda. It seems to have bothered you very deeply.
Hai. It has.

Fields.MenuText: Would you like me to stop mentioning it?
Chiyoda, what will you do if it happens again?
I hope you've not been avoiding the problem.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd like that very much. I hope it's not a sign of weakness that it’s a sore subject for me. It would just serve to improve my mood, I guess.
I don't know, Kanchou. I'd like very much not to think about that until it happens again.
I haven’t. I just don't see any use in thinking about it when it is not necessary to do so.
Well, I'm here if you ever want to talk about it.
Excuse me, Kanchou, but.. maybe another time.
Of course.
Look at what's shown up right on time. Are you fit for battle?
Hai!
@BATTLE
You can relax now, Chiyoda.
Are? How do you mean?
The pilot's gone. That little chapter is closed.
Oh.
I must admit to some amount of guilt at the relief I feel at his leaving us.
Why is that?
I have nothing against the man. He was perfectly pleasant and he suffered a fair amount of trauma...
True.
Yet I wanted so deeply for him to leave us.
But it had nothing to do with his character?
Of course not. He was polite and amiable - I certainly don't bear him any ill will.
Then I don't think you have anything to feel guilty about.
Kanchou... arigatō.

Fields.MenuText: I still hope you'll find it in yourself to explain your... apparently very complicated thoughts on that man soon.
By the way, I'd very much like to know what disturbed you so much about all this. No pressure, but...
You do understand that, sooner or later, I'm going to need to hear an explanation for your feelings here. Or at least a promise that there's no operational significance to them.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope I find that in myself too. Truly I do.
It would be in everyone's best interests that I discover that strength soon. I hope that I do.
Of... of course, Kanchou. I understand.
It's about time to engage the enemy of the day.
Is it not early, Kanchou?
We've had reports of a fleet to the west. I don't think there's any compelling reason to wait for them to come to us.
Hai!
@BATTLE
Whatever symbolic significance he had for you, it didn't come through in the way you treated him. You were never anything but pleasant.
I'm very glad we found the time for a bit of golf, Kanchou.
Agreed. I mean, my drive isn't what it should be - but I'm very grateful for a moment of peace.
It seems as though our times of peace have been lasting longer and longer lately.
You do know that we're approaching another fleet of Morganas, yes?
Hai! But I mean in general. Things are quiet.
Perhaps we're seeing the tail end of this war?
I think we're in the eye of the storm, and I think the calm is deceptive. If we let ourselves get complacent, I'm afraid we'll pay for it - probably sooner rather than later.
... You're right, of course.
These are times of war. One must always be prepared.
I'm afraid so.
This can't last.
Not until the war's over.
You're right. I mustn't forget that.
You shouldn't let it distract you from my hilariously awful putting, though. I wonder if I slept on my arm wrong last night, or...
... Kanchou? Look to port.
Okay. You should now be distracted from my putting.
To arms!
Hai!
@BATTLE
That... would be nice.
You don't think it's true.
No. Sorry.
Kanchou? What's happened? What are you doing in the infirmary?
Chiyoda, I need you to wait outside. Now.
What has happened here? Did we not drive the Funayūrei back?
I said leave, Chiyoda! That's an order!
Get out! Get out of my plane, you bitch! Aaaaah!
Wh-... oh no...
Chiyoda...
Get out of me! I- I- I can't see! Somebody help!
Get him restrained, dammit! Chiyoda!
K-Kanchou!
We have another fleet approaching! I need you to get out of here and begin prepping the crew! Quickly!
But-

Fields.MenuText: This isn't for your sake, it's for everyone's! Get. The men and women. To their stations.
Chiyoda, for my sake! I need you out of here!
Chiyoda, leave this instant! That is an order!

Fields.DialogueText: Aaaah! Hai!
Aaaah! Hai!
Aaaah! Hai!
Go!
@BATTLE
Chiyoda?
Hello, Kanchou.
I haven't seen much of you since the infirmary.
Gomennasai. I've been enjoying some... alone time.
I see you have your easel out. What are you painting?
Nothing. Not yet. Something will come to me, I'm certain.
Chiyoda. Are you okay? Do we need to put in for a different assignment?
Chigau! I can do my duty!
... All right, then.
Gomennasai, Kanchou. I need to stay out here where things are... bad.
Forgive me if I say it sounds like you're trying to punish yourself.
I'm trying to overcome a weakness, Kanchou. I know I can do it.

Fields.MenuText: You're worrying me, Chiyoda.
I know you can, too.
I don't suppose you can tell me exactly why this is bothering you so much?

Fields.DialogueText: Please don't be frightened, Kanchou. I'd like very much to sit down with you and explain this... whole thing, soon.
You're very kind to trust me, even when I've been acting so strangely.
Soon. I promise you, Kanchou, soon.
We have a fleet of Morganas approaching. Are you battle-ready or should we flee?
Kanchou?
Yes?
You've... never asked me that before.
I've never needed to.
I see.
I'm ready, Kanchou.
Battle stations, Chiyoda!
Hai!
@BATTLE
Kanchou?
Chiyoda, come in.
Can we talk?
We're approaching a fleet of Morgana pretty quickly - but, hey, when's the last time that stopped us? How can I help you?
I wanted... to apologize.
For what, exactly?
I understand that I've been very hard to read lately.
I don't imagine I've been very easy to deal with lately with my panicking over these strange happenings.
I wanted to express, personally, my deepest remorse over my behavior.
Chiyoda, I'm not worried about that.
I'm more worried about you.
What?
Pilots are having visitations. The crew's starting to have waking nightmares. You think I blame you for being alarmed? And for not knowing how to respond?
I know you're sensitive. And I don't mean "fragile" or "overly emotional" or anything loaded. You pick up on things most people don't.
Kanchou, please... I know I'm already a burden on you.

Fields.MenuText: No. That is *not* the word I would use.
Oh, just relax and let me compliment you, okay?
Do you hear me complaining?

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou...
Kanchou...
Kanchou...
Perhaps we should go and check on the Funayūrei. I believe we've just about reached them.
That would be best, yes.
@BATTLE
And I know that must be exhausting in the best of times, and I can see the toll the last couple of weeks has taken on you.
I know you've been trying to carry that weight alone, and I think I will never fail to be impressed by your composure.
I just wish I could find a way to help you more.
Chiyoda? What are you doing out here?
Oh, hello, Kanchou. I'm just looking out at the ocean.
No golf? No painting? You're usually so active.
Well...
Perhaps I should spend more time doing this.
When a person, or whatever I may be, finds themself facing a situation over which they have little control...
It may be best to slow down and ask one's self what is possible and what isn't. Maybe we are often in positions of less control than we realize.
Maybe we just don't notice it at the moment.
I guess I'm doing just that, then.

Fields.MenuText: First rule of Kanchou school - trying to control what won't be controlled is folly.
I don't follow you, Chiyoda. You've lost me.
Y'know, there's a fine line between mature acceptance and fatalism.

Fields.DialogueText: That's exactly what I've been thinking. Perhaps I should stop...
That's perfectly fine, Kanchou. I guess... I guess this is something I should handle myself.
Maybe you’re right. But maybe I don't have the strength to even try controlling... whatever it is I'm trying to control.
I do hate to interrupt, Chiyoda, but we've got Morganas at 6 o'clock.
Hai! To arms, then!
Hey, that's my line!
@BATTLE
That was a phenomenal job you did on that last battle, Chiyoda.
Are?
I know you've had a lot on your mind.
But it hasn't affected your combat performance, and it certainly hasn't kept you from inspiring the crew. Even if you weren't a ship's kami, you'd be a superb officer.
That's extremely kind of you to say.
I can't say that I agree, though.
And why not?
It was only so long ago that I was freezing up in the middle of battle because I...
Because you...?
Because I thought I was going to die.
Chiyoda...

Fields.MenuText: You didn't freeze up. Not even for a second. Every moment that mattered, you were there and fighting.
You fought a mortal battle through a panic attack. Chiyoda, that's a mark of strength, not weakness.
That's no indicator of your current abilities. I’ve seen you grow stronger and more resilient every single day since then.

Fields.DialogueText: But I can't escape how close I was to losing it.
But I can't escape how close I was to losing it.
But I can't escape how close I was to losing it.
If anything should be bringing out those feelings in you, Chiyoda, a fight to the death should be the thing to do it.
You've got a reserve of strength unlike anyone I've ever known.
Kanchou... Dōmo arigatō gozaimasu!
Looks like a group of Morganas are attempting to sneak up on us. I say we punish them for it.
Hai. Let's.
@BATTLE
Do you have a moment, Kanchou?
Actually, I was about to go get something to eat - if you'd like to walk with me?
Oh. Hai. Thank you.
What can I help you with?
I'm ready to talk about it. Not all of it. But some of it.
Are you?
In the past few days, very very recently, after all this began... I've been having nightmares.
Nightmares about the Funayūrei.
You think this is some kind of attack? Or... I don't know, precognition?
It didn't feel like a premonition. Just... horror. And unease.
Okay...
One of them manages to board the ship.
Don't they have the ability to do that any time they like anyway, if they're close enough? With their spectral abilities?
They do, as do I. Spirits of ships and all that. But it's hardly useful, it leaves us vulnerable for mortal wounds and accomplishes nothing.
Yet this one makes the decision to every time in my dream.
I worry that one of them will attempt to do this. Why, I do not know.
Sounds like you *do* think it could be a premonition.
I guess it's possible. It just doesn't feel that way.

Fields.MenuText: What matters is that you have told me now. Any later and we might have been in trouble.
We've not been left at a disadvantage yet. I'll make sure the crew are equipped with weapons to protect themselves on the deck.
Maybe it's nothing, Chiyoda, though I'm glad you told me regardless.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand. I'll be sure to open up quicker next time.
That's good. I should not have been so closed up as to have kept this secret. I must be more open.
If it happens again, anything like this, I'll open up to you quicker. Even if it hurts.
Yeah. I don't like the idea of making you open up before you're comfortable - but, with the presence of visions and nightmares, this could be pertinent.
I want to hear more about you and what you feel when you're ready for it. Let me know the vital stuff quickly.
The rest, you tell me in your own good time.
Hopefully sometime other than during our daily workout.
Ah. Is it here?
It is.
I'll get the men and women to their battle stations!
Good!
@BATTLE
Chiyoda? What's with the alarms? Are there more Morganas in the area?
I appreciate it. Are you all right?
I'm fine, Kanchou. Honestly.
Don't take this the wrong way, but - were you just catching your breath, or were you listening for something?
If there's a chance there are still Morganas in the area, I'd rather play it safe.
I really was just collecting myself, Kanchou - but everything's fine. Where do you need me?
Okay, if you're sure, I need you to make a quick check and make sure all the crew's accounted for. If yes, coordinate damage assessments.
Hai!
Hey, Chiyoda, wait!
Hmn?

Fields.MenuText: Good work back there.
You should probably know I'm putting you in for a commendation. Valor under fire, that kind of thing.
Nothing. Back to it, Chiyoda!

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō. And same to you!
Kanchou... that really isn't necessary. I don't even...
Hai!
Godspeed.
Hmn...
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
Chiyoda!
Oh! Gomennasai!
I... I think they're gone. I'll shut down the klaxons.
Be humble later. Duty first.
Kanchou!
Chiyoda! What's wrong?! Are you hurt?
Kanchou! I see them! I see them - they're looking right at us!
They're... they're attacking me where I'm most vulnerable now. They're reaching the core of me.
Kanchou. I'm ready to fight back. There's no more time to waste!
Listen, when this siege is over, you and I are going to talk.
But for now I need to know whether I need to get you to the infirmary or if you can still fight the old-fashioned kind of fight!
Kanchou, this can't wait!

Fields.MenuText: It's going to have to! There are Morganas right at our doorstep!
This will take us a few hours at most. Chiyoda, please!
For the sake of the men, I need you to wait just a little while longer!

Fields.DialogueText: I... understand.
I... understand.
I... understand.
I can fight.
Are you sure?
Hai.
Okay. But, listen, if you need to get away from the bridge, do what you have to. I know you're fighting on two fronts.
Thank you, Kanchou. But I won't let you down!
@BATTLE
I'm sure they are. We're almost in firing range.
Chiyoda, you're under attack right now. You understand that, right?
Hhh - hai. But, Kanchou...
Tell me what's going on.
I know. The shooting's going to start in about two minutes.
Chigau! I don't mean that! I mean, against their influence, or their powers, or...
Kanchou, what's happening?
What's happening with the crew? What's going on?
Same thing that happened to you, Chiyoda. Visions, waking terrors - I don't know what else to call it.
Yabai, dōshi-yō...
They're attacking our minds, though God knows how.
This is bad.
Yes. This is bad. Thankfully we drove them back with what little of the crew was still able to fight.
Those still of sound mind are taking the others to their bunks.
Not to the infirmary?
Not enough room for them all. Plus, they show no signs of physical injury.
Kanchou...
What did they see?
I don't know, exactly. Most of them are speaking gibberish.
But there does seem to be one unpleasant recurring theme...
It's you. They seem to be afraid you'll sink the ship.

Fields.MenuText: It's a dream, Chiyoda. They'll snap out of it.
Don't take it personally, Chiyoda. This doesn't reflect on you.
It's fairly clever, in an evil kind of way. You're an inspiration to the crew - if the Morganas can poison that...

Fields.DialogueText: What if they can't snap out of it? How could you possibly know?
I know it doesn't... and yet I don't... how am I supposed to convince my own self?
Oh, Kanchou! How could they ever trust me again?
We can't talk about this right now. I'm still here. They trust me. I trust you. We can rely on that.
Hai.
We have a few stragglers to take care of - if we're lucky, that may break this spell. Are you ready?
Hai!
@BATTLE
Wait - report first. Engine troubles sorted?
Hai. I've done what I can, anyway. The engineering team is... they're not there.
You wanted to speak to me, Kanchou?
Come in, Chiyoda.
I need to talk to you.
Of course. What do you need?
Those visions you were talking about. Have you had them in your sleep?
I have. Why?
I've begun having them myself.
Dame, dame, dame... this can't be happening, how could-
Chiyoda, I didn't call you in here to frighten you. We've got some Morganas approaching. We need to discuss strategy.
Kanchou, this is bad. How are we supposed to handle this?
That's why you're here. If the crew has another massive collapse, what are we going to do about it?
I don't know! This is horrible, I don't even know where to begin...
I know it's horrible, Chiyoda, that's why I’ve called you here. We need to discuss tactics.
How? This is unlike anything we've ever faced before!

Fields.MenuText: Take a breath. Just... take a breath.
Chiyoda. Relax. You're right - this is new. Which is why we need to strategize.
Get a hold of yourself - that's an order!

Fields.DialogueText: How can we talk about it? We're completely unprepared for this, at what point do we-... oh.
Eep! Yes, Kanchou! You're... you're...
You're right. I'm okay. And I agree. For the good of the crew, we need to discuss actual solutions.
We don't have time to address the men and women just now, before the Funayūrei arrive. We will do that after this upcoming attack.
For the time being... we send out a message telling them all to keep a constant eye on the sailors beside them. It's the best we can do.
That sounds like a plan, Chiyoda. That's what I was looking for.
I believe the Morganas are moments away. Go make the announcement.
Hai!
And get to your battle station!
Hai!
@BATTLE
And... be brave, Kanchou. I'm not going to let them get you.
Kanchou, whatever those dreams are showing you, you know I would never betray you. I would never do anything to hurt you. I would die a thousand times before...
It'll take more than a flotilla of demon ships to make me doubt that, Chiyoda. The fiery devil monkey hallucinations are a bit more problematic, just because they're distracting.
It feels very real when they bite, annoyingly enough.
Kanchou, the men and women seem to be recovering!
They damn well better be. We've got a strange Morgana approaching and I don't know what we're going to do.
Kanchou! There's something we need to talk about right now while we've got the time!
We *don't* have the time, Chiyoda. Save it `til after the fight.
Do we not have even a minute? I fear that the fidelity of our--
Is it relating to the battle or the Morgana that's approaching us?
Well, no, though I do have information relating to that.
I'm listening - but talk faster!
We've had reports of some kind of modified Funayūrei following some distance behind the primary force.
Other ships seem to be converging on its location, but if we can punch through this lot we should be able to engage before things get too out of hand.
Then let's see about punching through this lot. Thanks.
Kanchou, there's more!

Fields.MenuText: Whatever you have to say, it sounds like it requires my full attention. I can't give that to you right now. You must understand that.
Chiyoda, in the past we've survived to resume our talks after a campaign. You have to know how this routine goes by now. It can't be more important than our very lives!
Chiyoda! Battle stations!

Fields.DialogueText: I-... I understand! To arms, then!
It's not... It isn't. We'll talk soon, Kanchou!
Eh--! Uhm, yes! Yes, Kanchou!
Good. I want to see your best work.
Hai. I promise to perform it, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, the... mutated Funayūrei is on its way! We've tentatively identified it as a Malice-type heavy cruiser... more or less.
Fantastic. We're prepared this time. With this, we may finally end these visions.
Kanchou, we really need to talk!
We've been over this, Chiyoda, we'll be-
I know what you said, Kanchou! This can't wait!
Kanchou-!
Kanchou, I-!
Chiyoda, we're wasting time! If we don't-
Kanchou, this invader may forever change our lives as we know it. I'll never forgive myself if I don’t get out what I need to say!
Which--is that somehow, even though I'm a spirit bound to this ship...
Even though I share some of the same spiritual qualities as our greatest enemy...
Even though you've been put through horrible visions of watching me ruin this ship and destroy our shared ambitions...
And even though I lose control and sometimes I can't help but stall our progress...
You've been the greatest Kanchou to ever board this ship! You've stood by my side and at no time have you wavered.
Never, in every moment that I've had thought and body and form, have I met a person with such strength of character and such compassion!
Who consistently uplifts even an unassuming seaplane tender such as myself.
I couldn't imagine an extraordinary Kanchou such as yourself wanting, for even a moment, to tie their life to this modest ship...
And to what I humbly stand for...
I don't expect you to respond to what I’m saying, Kanchou.
I'm honored that you would listen during what may end up being our darkest breath.
Just know that our venture has meant the world to me.

Fields.MenuText: Chiyoda...

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou...
Kanchou...
Kanchou...
We've got a battle to win.
Battle stations, Chiyoda!
Hai!
@BATTLE
... I'm watching you, imaginary monkey.
Chiyoda! I should have known I'd find you on the bridge. You took off so quickly at battle's end...
I understand. It really was. And... well done!
We defeated the dark intruder.
The crew is as lucid as they ever get.
I think a lot of us - myself included - are actually feeling a kind of catharsis. The Morganas hit us with fear, and we're stronger for having beaten them back.
I feel the same, Kanchou.
Chiyoda, your work was unimpeachable. As usual.
Arigatō.
You realize that we now have time to talk.
I don’t... know if there’s anything else left to say, Kanchou.
Oh, really? Among other things, you expressed genuine concern over your existence as a Belle. Same spiritual something-or-other as our enemies?
... Hai.
And these doubts started with that nightmare-wracked, yet friendly pilot?
Not exactly... In truth, it was ever since you came back from shore leave. I realized then that I could never join you on land - say, at a restaurant.
Oh?
I'm a ship, not a person, Kanchou.
These days, who's to say whether the two are mutually exclusive?
Do you know why I'm a captain, Chiyoda?
Because I love the sea. I couldn't be back from shore leave soon enough. Restaurants be damned.
I wouldn't be here if I didn’t already love the ship that I command.
And you, Chiyoda, are a delightfully essential reason for why I feel that way.
Am I, Kanchou?
Yes. Your creative resilience is what I’m drawn to the most.
Kanchou...
And I agree - and feel - we make a singularly fine team.
Glad to hear it, Kanchou.
Haha. Chiyoda! At least in this moment, will you kindly drop the formalities?
Kanchou... How about we cook up supper for two tonight, and dine right here on the bridge? With the ocean’s infinite horizon before us.
Sounds enticing! And for dessert?
Sweet Kareyumaki, of course. Maybe even topped with a kiss.
Well, now, Chiyoda! You couldn’t possibly paint a more stunning picture.
I-uh-just needed some air. That was intense.
